climbs.name: I Need to Move
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Climb the left side of a small pillar to a stance below a bulge.  Move left on ok hands and horrible feet.  Finish on a nice face following pockets and crimps to the cable anchor around the tree.
This is the TR to the right that shares anchors with Boo-Boo.

climbs.name: Vern's Jewels
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Starting on the left side of a slab, make a steep move left across an arête to gain a stance.  Continue on easier rock.

climbs.name: T-Rex
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA by Nick Vitali; 2016.

content.description: Climb up a crack to a right facing corner.

climbs.name: Pacifier
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description:
Start in an orange corner and pull a tricky bulge, follow a crack and corner to the anchors.

About 200 feet to the right of

Pacifier

, there are a couple short routes.

Routes are listed Left to Right.

climbs.name: Neo Con
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA by Kira Engle; 2016.

content.description: Directly behind the big juniper climb a tough crack to a deep double dihedral. Take the left side of the double corners to the anchors.

climbs.name: Holding Out for a Hero
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Start on featured rock and move up into an overhanging left facing corner.  Pull through the apex of the corner on pockets and move left to the finishing slab of Busted.  It’s possible to avoid the crux and move left to the stance below slab sooner.  This lowers the grade to 5.10.

climbs.name: Hey Boo Boo
climbs.fa: Bolted and FA by Jeff Roads; 2016

content.description:
About 200 feet to the right of Vern’s Jewels and Bedtime Story is a detached pillar with an obvious chimney. Continue right around a buttress where the crag aspect turns from North West to West.  Jeff Rhoads put 2 routes in this area. There is potential for more.

Hey Boo Boo is the bolted line and shares anchors with Yogi.

climbs.name: Busted
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Start in a left facing corner with excellent rock.  A series of stout moves leads to a finger crack through the bulge and a stance below a tree.  Move up and right on slightly slabby rock with good pockets to the anchors.

climbs.name: Bromancing the Stone
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: On the right side of the pillar, move up to a thin crack and follow it over a bulge to a stance, move left on steep pockets to the anchors.

climbs.name: Bedtime Story
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Climb a slab to a steep corner and follow it to the anchors.

climbs.name: Back in Business
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA by Terran Engle; 2016

content.description: Start in a shallow double dihedral to gain a ledge, make a hard move off the ledge to gain a left facing corner.  Continue on sustained pockets to the anchors.

climbs.name: Bad Boyz
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA by Terran Engle; 2016

content.description: Follow cool hueco features up and right to balancy corner.Move slightly right to gain a stance below the final headwall.  Trend left and follow pockets and crimps to the anchors.

climbs.name: Baby Steps
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Follow a wide crack in a corner to a bulge and pass the bulge by moving slightly right.  Continue to the anchors.

climbs.name: Air of the Dog
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Face climb up to a big roof and follow a weakness to a left facing corner and the anchors.

climbs.name: Air of Feasibility
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Hard, steep climbing off the ground leads to left leaning rail and a very hard pull onto a shelf. Move right then left up a tricky arête to the anchors.
